Validate Input Data for Joint ODE Modeling

Source: R/utils.R
validate.Rd

Performs comprehensive validation of longitudinal and survival data to ensure they meet the requirements for joint ODE modeling. This function checks data integrity, formula validity, variable consistency, and temporal alignment between longitudinal measurements and survival outcomes.

Usage

validate(formula.long, formula.surv, data.long, data.surv, id, time)

Arguments

formula.long

A formula object specifying the longitudinal model. The left-hand side should contain the longitudinal outcome variable, and the right-hand side should specify covariates.

formula.surv

A formula object specifying the survival model. Must have Surv() on the left-hand side with time and status arguments. The right-hand side specifies baseline covariates.

data.long

A data frame containing longitudinal measurements with multiple observations per subject, ordered by subject ID and time.

data.surv

A data frame containing survival/event data with exactly one row per subject.

id

Character string specifying the name of the subject identifier variable. Must be present in both data.long and data.surv.

time

Character string specifying the name of the time variable in data.long for longitudinal measurements.

Value

Returns invisible(NULL) if validation passes. Throws an error with descriptive message if validation fails.

Details

The validation process includes the following checks:

  • Input type verification for all arguments

  • Data dimension checks (non-empty data frames)

  • Variable existence in respective data frames

  • Survival formula structure (must use Surv())

  • Missing value detection in critical columns

  • Duplicate ID detection in survival data

  • ID consistency between longitudinal and survival data

  • Time value validity (non-negative for longitudinal, positive for survival)

  • Temporal alignment (warns if measurements exist after event/censoring time)

  • Event status validation (must be 0 or 1)

  • Observation frequency assessment

See also

process for data processing after validation

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example with simulated data
data.long <- data.frame(
  id = rep(1:100, each = 5),
  time = rep(0:4, 100),
  v = rnorm(500),
  x1 = rnorm(500)
)

data.surv <- data.frame(
  id = 1:100,
  time = rexp(100, 0.1),
  status = rbinom(100, 1, 0.7),
  w1 = rnorm(100)
)

# Validate the data
validate(
  formula.long = v ~ x1,
  formula.surv = Surv(time, status) ~ w1,
  data.long = data.long,
  data.surv = data.surv,
  id = "id",
  time = "time"
)
} # }
